item.title: So you want to be a computational biologist?
item.description: Recently I ran into this wonderful article published in Nature Biotechnology written by Nick Loman and Mick Watson, about how to become a computational biologist. The article is so brilliant and I thought I should dedicate my (actual) first post to write about it. Understand your goals and choose appropriate methods Key to good computational biology is the selection and use of appropriate software. Before you can usefully interpret the output of a piece of software, you must understand what the software is doing.
